overview: From 2026-01-01 to 2026-02-01, elizaos-plugins/registry had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add @kamiyo/eliza plugin
topPRs.author: kamiyo-ai
topPRs.body:
## Summary Adds @kamiyo/eliza - an ElizaOS plugin for escrow payments, dispute resolution, and on-chain reputation on Solana. **Features:** - 5 actions: CREATE_KAMIYO_ESCROW, RELEASE_KAMIYO_ESCROW, FILE_KAMIYO_DISPUTE, CONSUME_PAID_API, CHECK_KAMIYO_REPUTATION - 3 providers: wallet context, active escrows, reputation history - 2 evaluators: quality assessment, trust scoring - 1 service: escrow monitoring with auto-dispute **Links:** - Package: https://github.com/kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol/tree/main/packages/kamiyo-eliza - Protocol: https://kamiyo.ai - Solana Program: [8sUnNU6WBD2SYapCE12S7LwH1b8zWoniytze7ifWwXCM](https://solscan.io/account/8sUnNU6WBD2SYapCE12S7LwH1b8zWoniytze7ifWwXCM)

Greptile Overview

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary Adds `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin to the registry - an ElizaOS plugin for Solana-based escrow payments, dispute resolution, and on-chain reputation management. **Issues Found:** - Entry is placed incorrectly in alphabetical order (should come after `@esscrypt/plugin-polkadot`, not before) - Uses non-standard GitHub reference format `#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza` for monorepo access - this syntax is not documented and no other entries use it - Unclear if the monorepo path syntax is supported by elizaOS's dynamic plugin loader **Recommended Actions:** - Fix alphabetical ordering by moving the entry to the correct position - Verify the monorepo syntax works with elizaOS, or restructure to use standard format ### Confidence Score: 2/5 - This PR has critical issues that must be resolved before merging - Score reflects incorrect alphabetical ordering (violates registry requirements) and use of undocumented monorepo syntax that may not be supported by the plugin loader - The `index.json` file requires corrections to alphabetical ordering and potentially the GitHub reference format

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 2/5 | Added `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin entry with alphabetical ordering issue and non-standard monorepo path format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant Validator as Registry Validator participant CLI as elizaOS CLI participant Loader as Plugin Loader Dev->>PR: Submit plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add @kamiyo/eliza entry Note over Registry: Entry added at line 206 Validator->>Registry: Check alphabetical order Registry-->>Validator: ❌ Out of order (@kamiyo before @esscrypt) Validator->>Registry: Check GitHub format Registry-->>Validator: ⚠️ Non-standard format (#main:packages/...) alt If merged with issues CLI->>Loader: Load plugin from registry Loader->>Loader: Parse github:kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza Loader-->>CLI: ❓ Unknown if monorepo syntax supported end Note over Dev,Loader: Required fixes:
1. Move entry after @esscrypt
2. Verify monorepo syntax compatibility ```

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 2/5 | Added `@kamiyo/eliza` plugin entry with alphabetical ordering issue and non-standard monorepo path format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant Validator as Registry Validator participant CLI as elizaOS CLI participant Loader as Plugin Loader Dev->>PR: Submit plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add @kamiyo/eliza entry Note over Registry: Entry added at line 206 Validator->>Registry: Check alphabetical order Registry-->>Validator: ❌ Out of order (@kamiyo before @esscrypt) Validator->>Registry: Check GitHub format Registry-->>Validator: ⚠️ Non-standard format (#main:packages/...) alt If merged with issues CLI->>Loader: Load plugin from registry Loader->>Loader: Parse github:kamiyo-ai/kamiyo-protocol#main:packages/kamiyo-eliza Loader-->>CLI: ❓ Unknown if monorepo syntax supported end Note over Dev,Loader: Required fixes:
1. Move entry after @esscrypt
2. Verify monorepo syntax compatibility ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: Add @zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router to registry
topPRs.author: takasaki404
topPRs.body:
This PR adds @zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router to the registry. - Package name: @zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router - GitHub repository: github:takasaki404/plugin-aimo-router - Version: 0.1.0 - Description: Use Models from AiMo Network (https://aimo.network) Submitted by: @takasaki404

Greptile Overview

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR adds `@zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router` to the elizaOS plugin registry, which provides integration with the AiMo Network for decentralized AI inference. **Key observations:** - Plugin repository structure is complete with all required assets (logo, banner, README, package.json with agentConfig) - Entry is correctly alphabetically ordered between `@tonyflam/plugin-openchat` and `plugin-connections` - GitHub reference format is correct (`github:takasaki404/plugin-aimo-router`) - Package name follows NPM scoped package conventions **Issues found:** - Formatting inconsistency: Uses 4 spaces for indentation instead of 3 spaces (matches existing entry above it, but inconsistent with 211 other entries) - Spacing inconsistency: Has space after colon (`: "github:`) instead of no space (`:"github:`) like 211 other entries ### Confidence Score: 4/5 - This PR is safe to merge after fixing the minor formatting inconsistency - The plugin addition meets all functional requirements (correct format, alphabetical order, valid GitHub reference, complete repository structure). The only issue is a minor style inconsistency with indentation and spacing that doesn't affect functionality but should be corrected for consistency. - The `index.json` file needs a quick formatting fix to match the existing code style (3 spaces, no space after colon)

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 3/5 | Added `@zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router` entry, but has formatting inconsistencies (4 spaces instead of 3, space after colon) |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant GHA as GitHub Actions participant Reg as Registry (index.json) participant Gen as Generated Registry participant CLI as ElizaOS CLI Dev->>PR: Add plugin entry to index.json PR->>GHA: Trigger review workflow GHA->>Reg: Validate JSON format GHA->>Reg: Check alphabetical order GHA->>Reg: Verify GitHub reference format Note over PR,GHA: PR Review & Approval PR->>Reg: Merge to main branch Reg->>GHA: Trigger registry generation GHA->>Gen: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>Gen: Fetch NPM package info GHA->>Gen: Determine v0/v1 compatibility GHA->>Gen: Write generated-registry.json CLI->>Gen: Fetch plugin registry Gen-->>CLI: Return plugin metadata CLI->>Dev: Display available plugins ```

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | index.json | 3/5 | Added `@zane-archer/plugin-aimo-router` entry, but has formatting inconsistencies (4 spaces instead of 3, space after colon) |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant GHA as GitHub Actions participant Reg as Registry (index.json) participant Gen as Generated Registry participant CLI as ElizaOS CLI Dev->>PR: Add plugin entry to index.json PR->>GHA: Trigger review workflow GHA->>Reg: Validate JSON format GHA->>Reg: Check alphabetical order GHA->>Reg: Verify GitHub reference format Note over PR,GHA: PR Review & Approval PR->>Reg: Merge to main branch Reg->>GHA: Trigger registry generation GHA->>Gen: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>Gen: Fetch NPM package info GHA->>Gen: Determine v0/v1 compatibility GHA->>Gen: Write generated-registry.json CLI->>Gen: Fetch plugin registry Gen-->>CLI: Return plugin metadata CLI->>Dev: Display available plugins ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Pushed a significant volume of code this month, totaling 9 commits with over 1200 lines of additions across 41 files. While this work has not yet been merged via a pull request, they also contributed to an ongoing discussion with a comment on a PR. The commits show a focus distributed across bugfixes, tests, and feature development.

standujar: This month, standujar focused on bug fixes, authoring 6 commits that modified 40 files (+732/-231 lines). They also participated in code review discussions by leaving several comments on pull requests. While this work has not yet been merged, their primary focus was on bugfix work.

borisudovicic: Focused on product definition and user experience for the `elizaos/eliza` repository this month. They created 20 issues that identified areas for improvement, including proposals for public agent functionality (elizaos/eliza#6302, #6305), user interface adjustments (elizaos/eliza#6310, #6318), and monetization changes (elizaos/eliza#6315). This work highlights a clear focus on shaping the product direction and user-facing features within the `elizaos/eliza` application.

0xbbjoker: Focused on bug fixing this month, opening a pull request (elizaos/eliza#6316) to address a parameterization issue in the SQL plugin. This single contribution involved modifying 3 files with +278 lines of new code and tests. Their work was concentrated entirely on this bugfix, with a strong emphasis on adding test coverage for the solution.

lalalune: Made a significant number of direct commits this month, resulting in a large-scale code modification across 11,424 files (+2,097,518/-200,949 lines). This activity consisted of 86 commits, with no associated pull requests or issues. The work was primarily focused on bugfixes.
rejected-l: Contributed to repository maintenance this month by merging one pull request in elizaos/eliza (#6301) to update the license year.
